events.name: ASEAN StrategyForum Internet of Things 2017 - Day 1

Free DataTorrent Enterprise Edition for qualifying startups. Check it out! Brought to you by DataTorrent, creators of Apache Apex.

events.name: Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, Uninterrupted Computing IT
events.description:
Gain yourselves the competitive edge, come and learn from the specialists for -
How you can achieve ISO 22301 Business Continuity Management certification
Government grants available for IT projects available
High-availability & Disaster Recovery in the cloud, and on-premise - how you can now overcome the limitations to run SAN-less clustering for any application
Machine Learning IT Analytics - How you can resolve issues and ensure optimum performance in your VM environments, through state-of-the-art AI Machine Learning automation.
SIOS Datakeeper/Protection Suite
HA & DR Failover Clustering without the high-cost/hassle
- The only block-level replication software that supports all environments including Windows and Linux, both on premise, VM and in the cloud - The only software that enables Windows clustering in the cloud through its clustering-integrated replication capabilities - The only software that offers both Synchronous and Async replication for both Linux and Windows · Support multi-site failover clustering using just Standard Edition SQL server, instead of Enterprise Edition SQL resulting in 50% cost reduction - Use Oracle Standard Edition with our software to gain high-availability, instead of Enterprise with RAC/Goldengate, at a fraction of the cost
SIOS iQ Machine Learning IT Analytics
More than just threshold monitoring/alert and dashboard, SIOS invented machine-learning technology that automatically "learns" your IT infrastructure behavior and provide -
- Performance root cause analysis for Instantaneous Issue Resolution- VMware vRealize Operations Manager 6.0 (vROps) Event Injection- Eliminate Wasted VM Resources- Capacity Forecasting - no need for manual threshold settings
Used by some of the most demanding enterprises in APAC including - AGL Australia • China Airlines • Dept of Transport and Main Roads Australia • Inghams Group Australia • Korea Education bureau • LG Display Korea • Mitsubishi Heavy Industries • NH Bank Korea • Nagaworld Casinos Cambodia • Nomura Research Institute (Shanghai) • Panasonic Asia • Razer Asia-Pacific Pte Ltd • Samsung Korea • Zespri New Zealand
Programme
8.30am Registration
9.00am Opening
9.15am ISO 22301 Business Continuity Management certification and government grants available
9.45am HA & DR SANless Clustering Solution (Cloud and On-premise)
10.15am Demo

Refreshments will be served and prizes to be given away at the event, register early as seats are limited!
For enquiries, call  +65 6842 9032

events.name: Productivity Workshop: Test-Driven Development Part I
events.description:
TDD is a software development approach where a feature is built incrementally through the repetition of very short development cycles. In this approach, the process is started by turning a requirement into a specific test case, then code is written to pass the test, and then the cycle is repeated by adding a test for another feature requirement. Benefits of TDD include faster feedback, reduced scope creep and over-engineering, and modular and maintainable code.
In this workshop, you will learn TDD practices and how to implement this approach in your own projects.
events.location: StackUp Studio, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-09, Singapore 139955

events.name: OrientDB - Graph Databases, Multi-Model DBMS and Game Of Thrones
events.description: The Talk  Luca Garulli is the founder of OrientDB, the first Open Source Distributed Multi-Model DBMS with a Graph Engine. After an introduction of Graph Databases and why they are so great to solve the Big Data complexity, Luca will explain the decision behind the creation of the Multi-Model DBMS and its pros/cons against the more classic Polyglot Persistence approach. At the end of the presentation, there will be a live demo of OrientDB and Game Of Thrones.  Bio  Luca is the Founder and CEO of OrientDB Ltd, the company behind the OrientDB Multi-Model NoSQL Open Source project. He's also the author of Roma Meta Framework project and he contributed to the Sun/Oracle JDO standard as a member of the JSR.

events.name: Bite 1 : Learn to write your first playbook with Ansible
events.description:
Ansible  :  Ansible is an open source configuration management, provisioning automation, application deployment and orchestration and ad hoc server management tool in one. Originally written by Michael De Hann, it's now acquired and promoted by Redhat and has an active community around it.  


What can I do with Ansible?  •  Provision infrastructure components on cloud e.g. compute, network, storage and other managed resources such as databases, caches etc.  • Install and configure system and application configurations  •  Software  Change management •  Deploy an application, do rolling updates etc.  •  Run ad-hoc commands on a group of servers in parallel 



Is this for me?  This workshop is for you if,  •  You are part of the ops team (systems/operations/network/infra engineers) and would like to learn how to manage systems at scale and automate common infrastructure tasks.  • If you are a part of development organization/ DevOps team and are involved in automating application deployments and orchestration.  • If you are a QA/Test engineer and are involved in building test infrastructure/setups frequently and use scripts or manual approach to doing that.   What topic will I  learn? •  Ansible quick overview  •  The language - YAML basics •  Playbooks - writing infrastructure as a code with Ansible •  Modules  -  The playbook plugins 



What will I  do during the workshop? •  Setup a cluster of Ansible nodes with a controller and 5 managed nodes •  Write a simple playbook to install an application and start service using core modules • Deploy application to the managed nodes  



What do I need to bring in?  •  BYOL - You bring in your own laptop. We will give you the software and the lab setup.   •  Internet Connectivity: We can not guarantee internet connectivity everywhere, so would be great if you come along with your own internet dongle, phone with wifi AP capabilities etc.   •  Lots of Enthusiasm: This is the most important pre-requisite :)  



Venue Entrance Guidelines: - Please arrive 5-10 minutes early.- Point-of-contact person: Mohd Sahnawaz, Rakuten- At CapitaGreen Building reception -> Guest Check-in with ID -> Take Elevator to Level 32nd --> Rakuten Reception
events.location: Rakuten, 138 Market Street, Lvl 32, CapitaGreen, 048946, Singapore
